segments.text: what was your wedding ceremony like , Abigail ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: my husband and I got married in a registry office with just two friends there as witnesses . But then we had three parties to celebrate .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: three parties ? That's quite a lot . That must have been expensive !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , since my husband and I are from two different countries , and we live in a third country , we decided to have one in each country . It wasn't actually that expensive .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: were your parents upset that they weren't there to see you get married ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I would have liked them to be there , but they couldn ’ t afford to fly out to see us , and we couldn't afford to fly out to see them , so they understood .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: did your husband's family get to meet your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: my husband's parents flew out to meet my family when we got married in my hometown , so that was great . Some people spend ridiculous amounts of money on extravagant wedding receptions , but we agreed t
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that makes sense . Did you go on a honeymoon ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: we waited until our one-year anniversary to go on our honeymoon to Africa .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you really didn't have a very traditional wedding , did you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: not at all , but we don ’ t have a very traditional marriage either , so it suited us perfectly !
segments.speaker: S2
